org.biopax.paxtools.io.sif.level2

Class ControlsTogetherRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.biopax.paxtools.io.sif.level2.InteractionRuleL2Adaptor
      • org.biopax.paxtools.io.sif.level2.ControlsTogetherRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InteractionRule, InteractionRuleL2

    public class ControlsTogetherRule
extends InteractionRuleL2Adaptor
    Implements Co-Control rule, which means A and B have a control over the same interaction. This class performs a recursive search both downwards and and upwards of a control that A is a controller. Upwards search always proceed to upwards, i.e. never switch back to downwards at any point. If this is directly upwards of the first control that we start the search, then all reachable B have dependent activity to A. Downward search, however, is different. It can switch to an upwards search when possible, to infer independent controls. There appears three possible search patterns, starting from the first control (of A), each provides only dependent or independent relations:
    • Upwards only --> dependent relation
    • Downwards only --> dependent relation
    • Downwards then upwards --> independent relation
    Author:
    Emek Demir, Ozgun Babur
